figgy.title: Order Manager doesn't display graphql error messages
Use catalog JSON-LD instead of Bibdata.

comments.body: @hackartisan You're talking about for titles? This changed a long time ago - we just never updated our fixtures. See for instance https://bibdata.princeton.edu/bibliographic/991234563506421/jsonld

I'm marking this ready for review.

The wireframes proposed putting a "Bulk Ingest" button next to recordings. However, the heading for that section is "Media Reserves", adding a feature that actually made it so you can bulk ingest resources would mean adjusting the BulkIngestController to handle change sets, and just adding bag support to BulkIngest generally solves this use case.

This would mean Kelly would just hit the bulk ingest button next to "Scanned Resources" to ingest bags.

> This would mean Kelly would just hit the bulk ingest button next to "Scanned Resources" to ingest bags.

It's not just Kelly, though, right? Is there anything we can do to make it a little more obvious where to go? Maybe add a new button that goes to the same form?

> It's not just Kelly, though, right? Is there anything we can do to make it a little more obvious where to go? Maybe add a new button that goes to the same form?

It's not just Kelly, but the whole workflow is managed through a documentation process right now. I'm not sure a "Bulk Ingest" button next to Recording is any easier, and I think closer to what we'd need is a full rework of how accessing and interfacing with "Bulk Ingest" is done so that it's obvious that's where you want to go and what your options are when you're in there.

Maybe I'm wrong though?

On home page:

Change "Media Reserves" to say "Audio", add a new box which says "Vendor Bags" and has a button that goes to the scanned resource Bulk Ingest screen and says "Bulk Ingest". Adjust the title of the scanned resource Bulk Ingest screen to say "Bulk Ingest Scanned Resources or Vendor Bags"

![Screen Shot 2022-09-08 at 12 28 07 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2806645/189209401-289b4257-9213-44a2-865b-ace6f891988d.png)
![Screen Shot 2022-09-08 at 12 28 29 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2806645/189209419-7a64f382-67d3-43fe-9efc-89b228c7f6fc.png)

> * Does this mean the workflow becomes:
>   
>   * Create a collection
>   * bulk ingest the bag into that collection

Yes

> * In the meantime does that form still work? i.e. it will still create a new collection for you?

Uhh. I think it won't add it to a collection if they use the AMC method. Maybe we should remove it from the home page?

orangelight.title: Only display language when not blank

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/52308346/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/52308346)

Coverage decreased (-0.02%) to 94.493% when pulling **e16ebc9ee0af047f5780fc224fc12d9cd803b6bb on lang_jsonld** into **fc157dcb4d17546c5a8156de8c0168fbc2e43c34 on main**.

orangelight.title: Catalog JSON-LD sometimes has a blank "lang" tag

comments.body:
Hrm, I think maybe there are two issues

* That a blank language tag is being indexed to Solr (see https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/9996490803506421/raw - currently includes `"language_code_s":["   "]`
* That this is being passed on to the jsonld. 

If the first weren't happening, we wouldn't have to worry about the second, but so that the Figgy work isn't blocked by a full reindex, I'm thinking I'll start with fixing the jsonld code in Orangelight, and the indexing work can be done under https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1986

I think you can use a new language field we introduced a while ago ''language_iana_s" . It is used in the html lang attribute in Orangelight. If there is no value it will not get indexed. 
https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/7c3e63c479ac2f9c8a59b53cfdbe878763ecf5bf/marc_to_solr/lib/traject_config.rb#L744

orangelight.title: Display Uniform title on Show page

comments.body: In order to display this field it needs first to be approved see https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1721

orangelight.title: Update ReCAP Partner Full Dump Rake Task to include new statuses
Constituent part(s) and Related record(s) fields largely duplicate one another

comments.body:
From `app/controllers/catalog_controller.rb`

```ruby
config.add_show_field 'related_record_s', label: 'Related record(s)', link_field: 'id'
...
config.add_show_field 'constituent_part_display', label: 'Constituent part(s)' 
```

I'm still not sure what we want to be displayed on the show page. It seems like the specific type of relationship is important to represent (that these particular related records are "constituent part" related records).

From notes:

> Duplicative display on host records https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/issues/3082
> Example from the ticket: https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/99124945733506421 
> Partner records might not link properly?
> Possible choices
> Make constituent parts linkable 
> Only display Constituent Parts, default to links, but in the rare case where the mms_id cannot be found in Solr, display only the id
> Similar issue with “Contained in” and “In”
> Suggested: Only keep “Contained in”, remove “In”. Display link when possible, when not possible, only show title.  Makes sense to start with just 773 and 774.
> Action Item: write proposal to re-factor Related Records/Constituent Parts into the same display section with hyperlinks. Kevin R. will draft ticket. 
>

On staging, it looks like this doesn't work on 5 SCSB records:

- SCSB-9588344
- SCSB-5715787
- SCSB-6740416
- SCSB-9401911
- SCSB-8915880

orangelight.title: Remove Barcode Login Option from the options to access "My Account"

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/52314642/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/52314642)

Coverage decreased (-0.001%) to 94.492% when pulling **71e68b00ed1ab7cdc6b3ab05f9bc35795968c481 on related_records** into **a5426b1d9b3b90b4bf7b696420eef3f546da1f1e on main**.

This currently does not work for SCSB records, since they do not have their local id in the `related_record_s` field; however, I am only finding 5 such records on catalog-staging (tunneled in link - http://localhost:9000/solr/catalog-staging/select?fq=related_record_s%3A*&q=id%3ASCSB*). For example:

* https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/SCSB-9588344
```
related_record_s: [
  "(OCoLC)1057895563",
  "(OCoLC)1080520347  "
],
...
constituent_part_display: [
  "Wadsworth, Alexander, 1806-1898. New plan of the city of Boston",
  "City of Charlestown, 1866. 1 map"
]
```

catalog-staging with PR at this point:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45948126/189193734-f2471550-5a66-4a07-bf12-d13f7190f273.png)

in production there are 9 records.
SCSB-9588344,
SCSB-12563166,
SCSB-5715787,
SCSB-11225801,
SCSB-11537300,
SCSB-6740416,
SCSB-12798531,
SCSB-9401911,
SCSB-8915880
Is there a way to create a scsb partial and render it with this field only if the document id is a scsb id?
